titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 204
CWG12191

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 8, Folder Box 8, Folder 20th Ky. Inf. - Misc

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, June 11th, 1864
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 204.
(Extract.)

12. At the request of the Governor of Kentucky, Private J. J. Ennis, 20th Kentucky Volunteers, is hereby honorably discharged the service of the United States, to date May 27th, 1864, to enable him to accept a commission in the 54th Kentucky Six Months' Infantry.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townssend
Assistant Adjutant General.

20 Infy
War Department.
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington June 11. 1864
Townsend E. D.
A. A. G.
Private J J. Ennis 20th Ky Vols is hereby honorably discharged the service to enable him to accept a commission
